poem:
**Chasing Chart Rainbows**

In York, echoes linger  
of Britpop nights—  
crimson as an old shed,  
forgotten until—  
a comeback, chords  
rising through morning frost.  
  
Gold rings in vinyl spins,  
two peaks in one year,  
mindblown skies,  
and rainbows chasing  
new dawns.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Absolutely mindblowing!’ Shed Seven score their second No 1 album of the year Shed Seven have cemented one of the biggest chart comebacks in British rock, scoring their second UK No 1 album of the year – over two decades on from their Britpop heyday. The band, who formed in York in 1990 and released their debut album in 1994, remain best known for hits such as Going For Gold and Chasing Rainbows, which channelled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
